most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS startup and authentication issues
common_issues.description: Users reported Pieces OS failing to start due to database corruption, resulting in a "LateInitializationError". This was addressed by identifying the database location for manual deletion and releasing a new version with additional logging. Separately, an authentication issue caused infinite loading when linking Google accounts after updating to version 11.3.0. This was resolved by a hotfix deployed by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start because it's unable to open database due to corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** Antoine79 is experiencing an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching due to an initial database bootup problem. Even after uninstalling and deleting the database folder, the problem persists.

**Key Points:**

* Initial bootup of Antoine79's database is failing.
* The issue is being investigated and a potential fix is being developed.
* New version with additional logging (11.3.1) will be released in 30 minutes.
* Antoine79 is scheduled for a support call on Wednesday.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Investigating the issue internally.
* Identifying the database location for Windows and macOS.
* Releasing a new version with additional logging for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is not yet resolved, but a fix is being developed.
* Antoine79 is encouraged to try the new version and report the results.
* A support call is scheduled for Wednesday for further troubleshooting if needed.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is potentially related to the database not being deleted correctly during uninstall.
* The additional logging in the new version should provide more information about the problem.
* The scheduled support call will be used to diagnose and resolve the issue definitively.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Authentication Issues on PiecesOS

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing infinite loading while attempting to link their Google account after updating to PiecesOS version 11.3.0.
* The issue occurs when accessing the authentication page at https://authentication.pieces.services/.
* Multiple users reported the issue, including on Windows 11 and using both Google and GitHub authentication methods.

**Problems Identified:**

* An issue in the authentication flow is causing the infinite loading loop.
* This is likely related to the new authentication flow implemented the previous week.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark, a Pieces support member, asked users to attempt login from the Pieces toolbar.
* After further investigation, Mark determined the issue and deployed a fix within a few hours.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The authentication issue has been resolved, and users can now link their Google accounts successfully.
* Mark confirmed the fix with affected users, and the issue is considered closed.

recommendations: **Proactively address database issues:** Develop a more robust database recovery or repair mechanism to prevent corruption and ensure smooth startup for users.
**Improve authentication flow testing:** Implement rigorous testing for authentication flows, especially after significant updates, to catch issues like the infinite loading problem early on.
**Enhance communication on known issues:**  During updates that force user logout, provide clear and prominent communication about the expected behavior to reduce user confusion and support tickets.
**Consider a dedicated status page:** For transparency and to reduce support load, consider implementing a status page that provides real-time information about service availability and known issues.
**Gather more detailed logs:** Implement more detailed logging around startup and authentication processes to aid in faster troubleshooting and issue identification in the future.
